thread.title: Bryan Mitchell to start Yankees’ spring opener Friday
thread.title_full: Bryan Mitchell to start Yankees’ spring opener Friday | Newsday

author: Erik Boland
title: Bryan Mitchell to start Yankees’ spring opener Friday
text:
TAMPA, Fla. — Bryan Mitchell will get a chance to make the first impression in the competition.
The righthander, one of five starters the Yankees are looking at to fill the last two spots in their rotation, will start Friday’s spring opener at Steinbrenner Field against the Phillies. Latest Yankees stories Dinner with Derek: Jeter mentors young Yanks MLB players’ union agrees to pitchless IBBs A-Rod says he won’t play again Lennon: Settled down A-Rod doesn’t miss playing Ellsbury’s arrival makes Yankees whole
The 25-year-old Mitchell shined all of last spring — opposing scouts consistently raved about him — before suffering a broken toe covering first base in his final exhibition outing March 31. Before taking the mound that day, Joe Girardi had announced Mitchell, who did return late in the season, would be on the Opening Day roster.
Adam Warren will start the second game Saturday in Clearwater against the Phillies, followed by Luis Severino on Sunday at home against the Blue Jays and Chad Green on Monday in Sarasota against the Orioles. Masahiro Tanaka will start Tuesday’s split-squad game at home against the Tigers while Luis Cessa will head to Fort Myers to face the Red Sox.
Mitchell, Warren, Green, Severino and Cessa comprise the quintet fighting for the fourth and fifth rotation slots. All of them appeared at some point in the majors in 2016. Yankees Scenes from Yankees spring training 2017
“I don’t really have any favorites going in, I don’t,” Girardi said. “I try to be completely open-minded when you look at this.”
advertisement | advertise on newsday
Cessa, 24, made the club out of nowhere last spring and went 4-4 with a 4.35 ERA in 17 appearances, nine of them starts.
The righthander said his changeup, which he lost feel of last season, has been good, something batters he’s faced in live batting practice sessions this spring have mentioned as well.
Keep an eye on . . . Lefthander Dietrich Enns, a 19th-round pick of the Yankees in the 2012 draft. The 25-year-old dominated in Double-A Trenton (7-2, 1.93 ERA) and in Triple-A Scranton/Wilkes-Barre (7-2, 1.52) last season and has looked sharp so far. Subscribe to Newsday’s sports newsletter
